meanings.definition: Resembling or having the consistency of glue.
meanings.sent1: The sticky slime felt gluish to the touch.
meanings.sent2: The paper had a gluish texture after the glue dried.
meanings.sent3: The gluish substance oozed out of the bottle, making a mess.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a gluish effect, sticking in my mind long after she spoke.
meanings.sent5: The gluish nature of the material made it difficult to remove from the surface.

meanings.definition: Tending to stick or adhere like glue.
meanings.sent1: The gluish tape held the pieces together firmly.
meanings.sent2: His shoes were so gluish from the mud that he couldn't walk properly.
meanings.sent3: The gluish candy wrapper clung to his fingers, refusing to let go.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was like a gluish bond, strong and unbreakable.
meanings.sent5: The gluish nature of the relationship made it hard to move on.
